memberdef.name: LARS

briefdescription.para: Set the parameters to LARS, pass in a precalculated Gram matrix, and run training.

detaileddescription.para: Both lambda1 and lambda2 are set by default to 0.

parameterdescription.para: Input data.
A vector of targets.
Should be true if the input data is column-major and false otherwise.
Whether or not to use Cholesky decomposition when solving linear system (as opposed to using the full Gram matrix).
Gram matrix.
Regularization parameter for l1-norm penalty.
Regularization parameter for l2-norm penalty.
Run until the maximum correlation of elements in (X^T y) is less than this.

memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Run LARS.

detaileddescription.para: The input matrix (like all mlpack matrices) should be column-major each column is an observation and each row is a dimension. However, because LARS is more efficient on a row-major matrix, this method will (internally) transpose the matrix. If this transposition is not necessary (i.e., you want to pass in a row-major matrix), pass 'false' for the transposeData parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Column-major input data (or row-major input data if rowMajor = true).
A vector of targets.
Vector to store the solution (the coefficients) in.
Set to false if the data is row-major.

simplesect.para: minimum cost error(||y-beta*X||2 is used to calculate error).

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::mat &data, const arma::rowvec &responses, const bool transposeData=true)
memberdef.name: Train

briefdescription.para: Run LARS.

detaileddescription.para: The input matrix (like all mlpack matrices) should be column-major each column is an observation and each row is a dimension. However, because LARS is more efficient on a row-major matrix, this method will (internally) transpose the matrix. If this transposition is not necessary (i.e., you want to pass in a row-major matrix), pass 'false' for the transposeData parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Input data.
A vector of targets.
Should be true if the input data is column-major and false otherwise.

simplesect.para: minimum cost error(||y-beta*X||2 is used to calculate error).

briefdescription.para: An implementation of LARS, a stage-wise homotopy-based algorithm for l1-regularized linear regression (LASSO) and l1+l2 regularized linear regression (Elastic Net).

detaileddescription.para: Let $ X $ be a matrix where each row is a point and each column is a dimension and let $ y $ be a vector of responses.
The Elastic Net problem is to solve
where $ \beta $ is the vector of regression coefficients.

If $ \lambda_1 > 0 $ and $ \lambda_2 = 0 $, the problem is the LASSO. If $ \lambda_1 > 0 $ and $ \lambda_2 > 0 $, the problem is the elastic net. If $ \lambda_1 = 0 $ and $ \lambda_2 > 0 $, the problem is ridge regression. If $ \lambda_1 = 0 $ and $ \lambda_2 = 0 $, the problem is unregularized linear regression.
Note: This algorithm is not recommended for use (in terms of efficiency) when $ \lambda_1 $ = 0.
For more details, see the following papers:
